intro: Sclerandrium, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, often clustered flowers that can range in color from white to pink or purple. The plant is typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Sclerandrium species are known for their ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun. The leaves are usually small and hairy, which helps reduce water loss in dry climates.
